Message.Msg: “The problem with ideology is, if you've got an ideology, you've already got your mind made up. You know all the answers and that makes evidence irrelevant and arguments a waste of time. You tend to govern by assertion and attacks.” – Bill Clinton, 2006 Man did he nail Obama exactly or what! That is Obama's philosophy from the start, 'I won, I know what to do, get out of the way.'

“The Dow hit 14,000. It hasn't been that high since 2007, heading toward an all-time high. Just think of how big it would be if Obama wasn’t such a socialist.” – Bill Maher Yet another great point made by an idiot.

Topic.Title: Mr. Frogg and Mr. Rat have dinner

Message.Msg: ... “Mr. Frogg and Mr. Rat have dinner” Ah, yes, little grasshopper, the ancient Confucian parable (which is still often seen on many Chinese restaurant menus, entitled, “Wun-Dum-Frog.” (Or perhaps The Frogg recently got it in his fortune cookie,” U wun dum frog – U N hot water now, froggie!” Which begs to ask, was it your political philosophy that left you out on the streets shivering by the light post on a cold and wintry night in the first place? That’s not “From each according to his ability…” – That’s “I’ve got mine, screw the rest of ya’!” (…which, if memory serves me, was soundly repudiated at the polls recently, was it not?) But while we’re on the subject, a somewhat premature Happy New Year to all my Chinese friends.

Topic.Title: Former AT&T CEO Doorman comments on subsidies to AAPL

Message.Msg: Not clear to me how and why the I-Phone market price is set at $699. In a year or two, I can easily see this price dropping to $199 with no subsidy based on alternative functionality provided by laptop computers. The share price of AAPL is certainly telegraphing what lies ahead.

Topic.Title: Former AT&T CEO Doorman comments on subsidies to AAPL

Message.Msg: Its seems all Apple products are priced at a premium to peer products. Is it underlying cost of production, superior products, brand loyalty, extreme demand or all of the above? Bottom line is, Apple consistently pulls it off. To top it off, T and other carriers help pay for some of Apple's sales, marketing and advertising expense by promoting the iPhone. It sure is a great country if you are Apple.

Topic.Title: Mr. Frogg and Mr. Rat have dinner

Message.Msg: Ah yes my dear friend Little Sir Echo, you are correct, around 51% of the voters did vote for the precious one, and his benign, utopian form of government through executive orders and government regulations. Yes my dear friend you are correct, there may come a day when the need for elected officials in any branch of our government will be deamed by the 51% to be antiquated, unnecessary and an impediment to good governance. Yes my dear friend you are correct, there may come a day when the need for any election may be deamed totally unnecessary by the 51%. Yes Little Sir Echo you are correct, because the collective has spoken. Let me get that lid for you, so that you can lay back and enjoy your nice warm bath. "In your heart you know he is right" The Frogg

Topic.Title: Mr. Frogg and Mr. Rat have dinner

Message.Msg: CONFUCIUS DID NOT SAY: " Passionate kiss, like spider web, leads to undoing of fly."

Topic.Title: Former AT&T CEO Doorman comments on subsidies to AAPL

Message.Msg: For the most part, you are correct but during the last few weeks, there aren't any Apple commercials by carriers, mostly Galaxy. Perhaps a wake up call for Apple.
Everybody else knows that Glen Beck was just "funing" Obama about blaming Bush for everything.

If Bill Maher had listened to his Econ 101 instructor he would know it is precisely because Obama is a Socialist that the Dow hit 14,000. With 80 billion dollars coming off the printing press each month with no backing, inflation is inevitable and the Dow may reach 28,000 long before Obama leaves office.

Message.Title: AT&T
Message.Msg: Does anyone discuss AT&T here or is this forum populated by the usual idiotic babbling?
Yes. and yes. T is a fine stock but it is kind of like watching the trees in the redwood forest grow.

Topic.Title: Mr. Frogg and Mr. Rat have dinner

Message.Msg: And there you have it, the heart and soul of the left, and the brilliance of the collective. If I had wanted to provide an example, I couldn't have done a better job than the one you provided within your post. You are truely an outstanding example of the 51%, and you should be proud. The one thing about old fools is that they have seen many things in their long lived lives, and I know you won't believe me, but there is nothing new about you or your comrades. Many of us have seen your type before, and know that your form of governance never works. But I do know that the kool aid is still fresh on your lips, and anything an old fool says is like spitting into the wind. So when all of the wheels finally fall off your collective wagons, I will always remember that you meant well. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg
